content: The Treasury Department is directing General Motors to prepare for a bankruptcy filing by June 1, despite GM's assertion that it could still reorganize without such a filing, The New York Times reported unnamed sources as saying on Monday. Members of President Obama's automotive task force are said to have been in discussion with GM officials and its advisers in Detroit and Washington last week and are expected to continue this week. The White House-appointed autos task force has given GM 60 days to come up with a restructuring plan and it is trying to determine whether the automaker can be a viable company. Quoting sources who had been briefed on the GM plans, the Times said the goal was to prepare for a fast "surgical" bankruptcy. Read: "http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,514823,00.html" "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

title: GM Prepares for 'Surgical' Bankruptcy

content: At $1.71 a share it seems that investors are prepared for more than bankruptcy, a share price that low seems to be the 'hopeless' way of saying 'bye-bye'.
